revised_title: Classical and Quantum Irrotational Motions of a Relativistic Perfect Fluid
tldr: The article analyzes the classical and quantum irrotational motions of a relativistic perfect fluid, focusing on the action functional and fluid equations. The study assumes the fluid is irrotational, isentropic, and acts as a test fluid without self-gravitation. The Lagrangian of the system is found to be the pressure, and the article explores the dynamics of fluctuations and the conservation of the Noether current.
